utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are getting ready for the flight to London and Monica comes running in.]

utterances.transcript: Guys, hurry up! The flight leaves in four hours! It could take time to get a taxi! There could be traffic! The plane could leave early! When we get to London, there could be a line at customs! Come on!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Guys, hurry up! The flight leaves in four hours! It could take time to get a taxi! There could be traffic! The plane could leave early! When we get to London, there could be a line at customs! Come on!! (She runs back to her apartment.)

utterances.transcript: Six-hour trip to London. That's a lot of Monica.
What do you got there?
Condoms, dude!
How come the writing is in Spanish?
Don't read my condoms!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Cut to the girls' apartment, Monica is putting things into her purse as Phoebe and Rachel watch.]

utterances.transcript: Passport, check! Camera, check! Traveller's cheques, check!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Passport, check! (As she puts away each item, she says check.) Camera, check! Traveller's cheques, check!

utterances.transcript: Who are you saying "check" too?
Myself. Y'know for remembering to pack a thing. Yeah, you do a good thing, you get a check! My mom does it, I never realised it was weird.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Myself. Y'know for remembering to pack a thing. Yeah, you do a good thing, you get a check! (pause) My mom does it, I never realised it was weird.

utterances.transcript: Yeah, my mom used to put her head in the oven. Well, actually, she only did it the one time. But it was pretty weird.
Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Hey! Are you ready yet?
Yep! You got the tickets?
Oh! Got 'em right here, check!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh! Got 'em right here, (Pats his coat pocket) check!
[Cut to the guys' apartment.]

utterances.transcript: It's all London, baby! Here we go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's all London, baby! Here we go. (He takes a picture of a less than enthused Chandler and starts towards the girls' apartment.)

utterances.transcript: You got your passport?
Yeah, in my third drawer on my dresser. You don't want to lose that.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Chandler glares at him. At first Joey doesn't know why, it takes him a little bit to figure it out.)

utterances.transcript: Ohh!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ohh!! (Runs to his room.)

utterances.transcript: There it is.

utterances.transcript: Okay, if you need the vacuum, it's in my closet on the left-hand side. Ah, the garbage bags are next to the refrigerator...
Okay, okay, but Rachel's gonna be here too, can't I just ask her this stuff?
Yeah, okay, give that a try!
All right! Let's do it!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, with Joey) All right! Let's do it!

utterances.transcript: Woo-hoo!!
Yeah, cheerie-o!
London baby!
Okay, 'cause that's not gonna get annoying.
London baby!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (louder) London baby!!

utterances.transcript: Hey, y'know what? I was wrong.
Well, we're all here! I guess we should get going!
Ohhh, I wanna come over there and give you a hug and wish you luck on your wedding, but I don't-can't get up.
Oh, I'll-I'll come hug you.
Great! Yeah, could you bring me the newspaper?
Yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. (He does so and Phoebe hugs him.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, have a great wedding!
Thanks.
Oh, hey, Chandler I wanna hug you too!
Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey! (Trots over)

utterances.transcript: Oh, and great! You might as well bring me my book, it's on the counter in your apartment.
Oh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh. (Goes and gets Phoebe's book as Rachel comes in from her room.)

utterances.transcript: So, we're off.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Rachel) So, we're off.

utterances.transcript: Have fun!
Thanks! Ugh, I can't believe you're not gonna be there!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thanks! (They hug.) Ugh, I can't believe you're not gonna be there!

utterances.transcript: Oh, I know.
So-so come! Why don't you come?
What?!
To London! Come to London. Please? It'll mean so much to me.
Yeah, well, I gotta work, I'm sorry.
Why-why can't you take a couple of days off?
Because, I can't! Ross, I told you, no. I can't.
This is my wedding.
All right, y'know what? We really are late! Let's go! Let's go! Let's go!!
Fine. You'll-you'll watch it on video when we get back.
Here you go Phoebe! Here you go Phobo! Phewbedo! Phaybobo.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, with Phoebe's book.) Here you go Phoebe! Here you go Phobo! Phewbedo! Phaybobo.

utterances.transcript: Thank you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughs) Thank you.
(Chandler kneels down with his arms spread waiting for his hug.

utterances.transcript: Thank you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thank you. (She pats him on his head.)

utterances.transcript: All right, let's go! Bye, Pheebs!
Bye, Pheebs!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They all start out, Rachel gives each one a kiss, and says "bye." In the hall, Joey says...)

utterances.transcript: London baby!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: London baby!! (And Rachel slowly closes the door, sadly.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, do you need a hug? You don't have to bring me anything!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (And with that, television history is made as, for the first time ever, an entire show moves it's entire production to an entirely different country to make a single episode. We get shots of Buckingham Palace, London Bridge, Big Ben, and the London Marriott as Joey and Chandler exit.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Another street, somewhere along the River Thames, Ross, Emily, and Monica are walking to where they're gonna get married. Emily is relating the troubles with the caterer.]

utterances.transcript: ...and that was all before 10 o'clock. The caterer rang and said it was going to be Chicken Kiev instead of Chicken Tarragon. And then the florist phoned to say there aren't any tulips. Oh, and the chilliest has carpel-tunel syndrome. We're not gonna be...
Whoa-whoa-whoa! Emily, honey, okay?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Whoa-whoa-whoa! Emily, (Gives her the time-out signal.) honey, okay?

utterances.transcript: Well, up yours too!

Sorry.
Sweetie, you gotta relax. Everything's gonna be great, okay? Come on. Come on.

Um-hmm! Doesn't that sound delicious at the last minute?

Yeah, y'know, but something like salmon which would be so much more elegant than the chicken. And, you wouldn't have to worry about the salmonella. But of course with salmon you'd have to worry about the chickenella... So, I can't wait to see this place you're getting married!

Afterwards, Joey tries to film Chandler with his video camera, and Chandler obviously hates this. Then, Joey falls asleep, and Chandler tries to take the video camera away from him. utterances.transcript: Hey!
So, what are you guys in the market for? We've got uh, scarves, tulip post cards...
Check this out? Huh? Yeah. That's the stuff. What do you think?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Check this out? Huh? (Joey has this big tall hat with a British flag on the front of it.) Yeah. That's the stuff. What do you think?

utterances.transcript: Well, I don't have to buy that, "I'm with stupid" T-shirt anymore.
Well, I like it. Here you go.

They're all tourists.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The hotel, Ross's room, Emily is entering.]

utterances.transcript: Hello?
Hey! I just spoke to your dad, and you know what? He seems to think we'll be able to find a new place for the wedding.
We don't have to.
Whoa-whoa-what? You found a place?
No. But, Monica and I were talking, and-and I was so upset about the hall being knocked down, and she suggested that we put the wedding off for a bit.
She said what?
She said, "If I'm not gonna be happy getting married somewhere that we find in a day, well then we should just postpone it."

Postpone it? Emily, do you think Monica realises how much our parents spent on this wedding? Do you my sister's teeny-tiny little brain comprehends that people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here, huh? This isn't right.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Postpone it? Emily, do you think Monica realises how much our parents spent on this wedding? Do you my sister's teeny-tiny little brain comprehends that people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here, huh? (He puts his pants on backwards.) This isn't right.

utterances.transcript: I realise that people are going to be disappointed. But, I'm sure they'll come back when we can do it right.
I can't ask people to do that? Would you ask people to do that?
utterances.transcript_with_note: I can't ask people to do that? Would you ask people to do that? (Holds out his pants)

utterances.transcript: Don't you point your pants at me! We have no choice! Anywhere that's half-decent would've be booked months ago, Ross don't you understand? This is our wedding I'm talking about.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Don't you point your pants at me! (She throws them on the floor.) We have no choice! Anywhere that's half-decent would've be booked months ago, Ross don't you understand? This is our wedding I'm talking about.

utterances.transcript: The only thing I understand is; postponing it is not an option. This is when we're getting married.
So what are you saying? It's now or never?
No. I'm saying it's now.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No. I'm saying it's now. (He starts putting on his pants, backwards again.)

utterances.transcript: Or?
There's no 'or' in mind. What is wrong with these pants?!!
It's not the pants. It's you that is backwards. And if, and if you don't understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we shouldn't get married at all!
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's not the pants. It's you that is backwards. And if, and if you don't understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we shouldn't get married at all! (She storms out.)

utterances.transcript: No, wait! Emily! No, wait, stop! Emily, please-
utterances.transcript_with_note: (chasing her, trying to zip up his pants. His got them on right now.) No, wait! Emily! No, wait, stop! Emily, please-(He catches something important in the zipper and howls like a little boy and falls to the floor.)

And a glass of tepid water.

utterances.transcript: Ooh, is this one of those things where you throw it in a bag with some graveyard dirt and hang it from a north-facing tree?

Uh, only if you have the hiccups too. Yeah, the pictures are for you, the water and the chocolate is for me. I just didn't feel like getting up. Okay, I'm gonna show you a picture of Ross. Okay? And you're going to remember all of the bad things about him. All right? Really focus on his flaws.
I can do that. I certainly did it when we were going out.

Okay. Umm, before we get started, I just wanna say for the record that I love Ross, I think he's such a great guy. Here. Okay, now, close your eyes. Okay.
Okay?
All right.
So uh, now look at the picture...
Okay.
All right, and umm...
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right, and umm... (She grabs the picture and smacks her in the head.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's hotel room. Chandler is trying to kick his shoe into a trash can that is standing on the TV. He can't do it.]

utterances.transcript: Well, this is just as boring in England.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Joey returns, still wearing his hat.)

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey. (He nods at the hat.)

utterances.transcript: Oh. Sorry!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh. (Takes off the hat.) Sorry!

utterances.transcript: No-no-no, y'know what? I really shouldn't have said that you were embarrassing me, I mean that really wasn't cool. And if it makes you feel any better, I've had a really lousy day.
Me too.
Yeah?
Noo!! I've had the best day ever! Dude, check this out! Now, I'm gonna fastforward past the part with you, 'cause it is boring.
Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Sh-shh-shh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Sh-shh-shh! (He motions for her to watch something he has taped.)
[Cut to the tape Joey made in front of some famous place in London with a rather famous English-type person.]

utterances.transcript: Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him that you like the hat.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on tape) Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him that you like the hat.

utterances.transcript: Okay, so umm, what's your friend's name?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Yep, Sarah, the Duchess of York) Okay, so umm, what's your friend's name?

utterances.transcript: Oh, Chandler.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on tape) Oh, Chandler.

utterances.transcript: Hi Chandler!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hi Chandler! (Waves)

utterances.transcript: That's... That's was...
Oh my God!
That's Fergie baby!!
Joey says you don't really like his hat, but I think it's kinda dashing.
So, I hear you're single now...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on tape) So, I hear you're single now...

utterances.transcript: Yeah, ummm, I don't like the hat that much.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, ummm, I don't like the hat that much. (She smiles.)

utterances.transcript: How did you? How? How?
Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right? So, I'm in my map and-and... Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right? So, I'm in my map and-and...(Ross enters) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Hi. I understand you had a little talk with Emily.
Yes, I did! And you are welcome!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughs) Yes, I did! And you are welcome!

utterances.transcript: Am I?! And was it your idea to postpone the wedding?!
Umm...
I'm gonna go to the bathroom.
Wait up!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wait up! (They both run to the bathroom.)

utterances.transcript: Hey-hey, since you're the 'fix-it' lady, here's a pickle, what do you do when the bride says she doesn't want to have the wedding at all?
She said that?!
Yeah.
Why?!
I don't know, I told her it was stupid to put off the wedding just because the hall was gone and she liked flipped out.
Oh my God. You're even dumber than I am!
Excuse me?
Ross, how long have you been planning this wedding?
I don't know. A month?

Emily has probably been planning it since she was five! Ever since the first time she took a pillowcase and hung it off the back of her head. That's what we did! We dreamed about the perfect wedding, and the perfect place, with the perfect four-tiered wedding cake , with the little people on top. Thanks. But the most important part is that we had the perfect guy who understood just how important all that other stuff was.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Emily has probably been planning it since she was five! Ever since the first time she took a pillowcase and hung it off the back of her head. That's what we did! We dreamed about the perfect wedding, and the perfect place, with the perfect four-tiered wedding cake (Starting to cry), with the little people on top. (Ross gets thrown a box of Kleenex from the bathroom and he gives her one.) Thanks. But the most important part is that we had the perfect guy who understood just how important all that other stuff was.

utterances.transcript: I had no idea. And that-that pillowcase thing, I thought you guys were just doing the flying nun.
Sometimes we were.
Come on. You gotta help me figure out what to do. Okay?
Okay.
Come on.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Come on. (They leave and Chandler sticks his head out.)

utterances.transcript: That was pretty intense huh?
Yeah. Hey, I hope Ross didn't think that we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. (Pause) Hey, I hope Ross didn't think that we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here!

utterances.transcript: I hope he did!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (glares at him) I hope he did!

utterances.transcript: Ooh! I thought of a good flaw! Ross pops his gum!
Oh, right! Wait a minute, I do that too.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, right! (BEAT) Wait a minute, I do that too.

utterances.transcript: Yeah, I know. It drives me crazy.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (The phone rings.)

utterances.transcript: I'll get it.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She answers it.)

utterances.transcript: Hello.
Hey, Pheebs! It's Joey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on phone) Hey, Pheebs! It's Joey!

utterances.transcript: Hey, Joey! Hey! Ooh! Ooh! I just say someone on the-that looks just like you on the subway. And I was gonna go over and say 'hi!' but then I figured, he doesn't care if he looks like you.
That just cost me four bucks. But uh listen, I just called to see how the chick and the duck are doing?
Ohh, they're having a great time with their Aunt Phoebe! Aunt Rachel hasn't been helpful at all. So, do you miss me?
Kinda, but I've just been having way too much fun.
So you're not homesick yet?
No, I don't think so.
All right, the seven of us miss you.
Who's seven?
Y'know, me, Rachel, the birds, the babies...
Ahh, the babies miss me?
Of course they do! Or I'm just really hungry.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (There is a knock on Rachel and Phoebe's door.)

utterances.transcript: Ooh, the pizza guy's here!
What? You ordered pizza without me?!
Yeah. But y'know we were thinking about you, y'know we ordered the Joey Special.
Two pizzas?!
Yep! Okay, gotta go, talk to you later.
Wait, well, where did you get it from?!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is in her bedroom.]

utterances.transcript: Pheebs?
Yeah?
Do you remember where the duck food is?
Yeah, it's in the guys' apartment under the sink. Why?
Because I'm going to London.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (enters with a bag packed) Because I'm going to London.

utterances.transcript: What?! What do you mean you're going to London?
Yeah, I have to tell Ross that I love him. Now honey, you take care, you don't have those babies until I get back.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, I have to tell Ross that I love him. Now honey, you take care, you don't have those babies until I get back. (Kisses her stomach.)

utterances.transcript: But what about all the "finding-his-flaws" stuff we've been doing?
Yeah, that didn't work.
I-Rachel, you can't go! Ross loves Emily!
Yeah, I know, I know, I know he does. But I have to tell him how I feel! He deserves to have all the information and then he can make an informed decision.
That's not why you're going! You're going because you hope he's gonna say, "Yeah, I love you too, Rach. Forget that British chippy."
Ohh-Do you think he will?!

No! Because he's in love with the British chippy! Look, Rachel, if you go, you're just gonna mess with his head and ruin his wedding! Y'know, it's too late! You missed you're chance! I'm sorry, I know this must be really hard, it's over.
Y'know what? No. It's not over until someone says, "I do."
utterances.transcript_with_note: Y'know what? No. It's not over until someone says, "I do." (Exits)

utterances.transcript: I do! I do! I do! I do! Ugh, like I can really chase you. I'm carrying a litter.
